00013    /*
00014    * Constructor
00015    */
00016    PairSelector::PairSelector()
00017     : pairType_(ALL),
00018       atom1TypeId_(-1),
00019       atom2TypeId_(-1),
00020       avoidDoubleCounting_(false)
00021    {}
00022 
00023    /*
00024    * Set policy to avoid double counting (true) or not (true).
00025    */
00026    void PairSelector::setAvoidDoubleCounting(bool avoidDoubleCounting)
00027    {  avoidDoubleCounting_ = avoidDoubleCounting; }
00028 
00032    bool PairSelector::match(const Atom& atom1, const Atom& atom2) const
00033    {
00034 
00035       // Check molecular identities
00036       if (pairType_ == INTRA && &atom1.molecule() != &atom2.molecule() ) {
00037          return false;
00038       } else
00039       if (pairType_ == INTER && &atom1.molecule() == &atom2.molecule() ) {
00040          return false;
00041       }
00042 
00043       // Exclude case where atom1 and atom2 are identical
00044       if (&atom1 == &atom2) {
00045          return false;
00046       }
00047 
00048       // Check atom types
00049       if (atom1TypeId_ >= 0 && atom1.typeId() != atom1TypeId_) {
00050          return false;
00051       }
00052       if (atom2TypeId_ >= 0 && atom2.typeId() != atom2TypeId_) {
00053          return false;
00054       }
00055 
00056       // Check for double counting
00057       if (avoidDoubleCounting_) {
00058          if (atom1TypeId_ < 0 && atom2TypeId_ < 0) {
00059             if (atom1.id() > atom2.id()) {
00060                return false;
00061             }       
00062          } else 
00063          if (atom1.typeId() == atom2.typeId()) {
00064             if (atom1.id() > atom2.id()) {
00065                return false;
00066             }       
00067          }
00068       }
00069      
00070       // If the pair has passed all previous tests, accept it. 
00071       return true;
00072 
00073    }
00074 
00075    /* 
00076    * Input a PairSelector from an istream, without line breaks.
00077    */
00078    std::istream& operator>>(std::istream& in, PairSelector &selector)
00079    {
00080       in >> selector.pairType_;
00081       in >> selector.atom1TypeId_;
00082       in >> selector.atom2TypeId_;
00083       return in;
00084    }
00085    
00086    /* 
00087    * Output a PairSelector to an ostream, without line breaks.
00088    */
00089    std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream& out, const PairSelector &selector) 
00090    {
00091       out.width(Parameter::Width);
00092       out << selector.pairType_;
00093       out.width(10);
00094       out << selector.atom1TypeId_;
00095       out.width(10);
00096       out << selector.atom2TypeId_;
00097       return out;
00098    }
00099 
00100    /* 
00101    * Input a PairSelector::PairType from an istream.
00102    */
00103    std::istream& operator>>(std::istream& in, PairSelector::PairType &type)
00104    {
00105       std::string buffer;
00106       in >> buffer;
00107       if (buffer == "intra" || buffer == "Intra" || buffer == "INTRA") {
00108          type = PairSelector::INTRA;
00109       } else
00110       if (buffer == "inter" || buffer == "Inter" || buffer == "INTER") {
00111          type = PairSelector::INTER;
00112       } else
00113       if (buffer == "all" || buffer == "All" || buffer == "ALL") {
00114          type = PairSelector::ALL;
00115       } else {
00116          UTIL_THROW("Unknown PairSelector::Type");
00117       }        
00118       return in;
00119    }
00120    
00121    /* 
00122    * Output a PairSelector to an ostream, without line breaks.
00123    */
00124    std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream& out, const PairSelector::PairType &type) 
00125    {
00126       if (type == PairSelector::INTRA) {
00127          out << "Intra"; 
00128       } else
00129       if (type == PairSelector::INTER) {
00130          out << "Inter"; 
00131       } else
00132       if (type == PairSelector::ALL) {
00133          out << "All"; 
00134       } else {
00135          UTIL_THROW("Unknown PairSelector::PairType");
00136       }        
00137       return out;
00138    }

00153    bool MpiTraits< McMd::PairSelector::PairType>::hasType = true;

00157 #include <util/mpi/MpiStructBuilder.h>   
00158 
00159 namespace McMd
00160 {
00161 
00162    /*
00163    * Commit MPI Datatype.
00164    */
00165    void PairSelector::commitMpiType() 
00166    {
00167       if (!Util::MpiTraits<PairSelector>::hasType) {
00168          MpiStructBuilder builder;
00169          PairSelector     object;
00170          builder.setBase(&object);
00171          builder.addMember(&object.pairType_, MpiTraits<PairSelector::PairType>::type);
00172          builder.addMember(&object.atom1TypeId_, MPI::INT);
00173          builder.addMember(&object.atom2TypeId_, MPI::INT);
00174          builder.commit(Util::MpiTraits<PairSelector>::type);
00175          Util::MpiTraits<PairSelector>::hasType = true;
00176       }
00177    }
